articles.headline: Biden’s Tax Plan Aims to Raise $2.5 Trillion and End Profit-Shifting
articles.snippet: The plan detailed by the Treasury Department would make it harder for companies to avoid paying taxes on both U.S. income and profits stashed abroad.
articles.abstract: The plan detailed by the Treasury Department would make it harder for companies to avoid paying taxes on both U.S. income and profits stashed abroad.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Large companies like Apple and Bristol Myers Squibb have long employed complicated maneuvers to reduce or eliminate their tax bills by shifting income on paper between countries. The strategy has enriched accountants and shareholders, while driving down corporate tax receipts for the federal government.
articles.byline: By Jim Tankersley and Alan Rappeport

articles.headline: AstraZeneca Vaccine Faces New Setbacks in U.K. and European Union
articles.snippet: Britain said it would give alternative shots to people under 30, while the European regulator said it had found a ‘possible link’ with rare blood clots.
articles.abstract: Britain said it would give alternative shots to people under 30, while the European regulator said it had found a ‘possible link’ with rare blood clots.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Britain said on Wednesday that it would curb the use of AstraZeneca’s vaccine in adults under 30 because of the risk of rare blood clots, a blow to the efforts of scores of countries reliant on the vaccine to stamp out the coronavirus pandemic amid a global surge in cases.

articles.headline: What’s in Biden’s Tax Plan?
articles.snippet: The proposal includes provisions to raise the corporate tax rate to 28 percent, make it harder for companies to move profits overseas and beef up the Internal Revenue Service.
articles.abstract: The proposal includes provisions to raise the corporate tax rate to 28 percent, make it harder for companies to move profits overseas and beef up the Internal Revenue Service.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Biden administration unveiled a tax plan on Wednesday  that would increase the corporate tax rate in the U.S. and limit the ability of American firms to avoid taxes by shifting profits overseas.
articles.byline: By Alan Rappeport and Jim Tankersley

articles.headline: Powerful Men Fall, One After Another, in France’s Delayed #MeToo
articles.snippet: Since the start of the year, well-known men from diverse fields have been accused of sexual abuse and placed under investigation.
articles.abstract: Since the start of the year, well-known men from diverse fields have been accused of sexual abuse and placed under investigation.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — When Sandra Muller started France’s #MeToo social media campaign in 2017, tens of thousands of women responded to her calls to “#ExposeYourPig.”

articles.headline: Biden Backs Taiwan, but Some Call for a Clearer Warning to China
articles.snippet: As China grows stronger and bolder, some experts want to end Washington’s decades-long policy of “strategic ambiguity.”
articles.abstract: As China grows stronger and bolder, some experts want to end Washington’s decades-long policy of “strategic ambiguity.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — If anything can tip the global power struggle between China and the United States into an actual military conflict, many experts and administration officials say, it is the fate of Taiwan.

articles.headline: Online Scammers Have a New Offer for You: Vaccine Cards
articles.snippet: Hundreds of sellers are offering false and stolen vaccine cards, as businesses and states weigh proof of vaccinations for getting people back to work and play.
articles.abstract: Hundreds of sellers are offering false and stolen vaccine cards, as businesses and states weigh proof of vaccinations for getting people back to work and play.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — On Etsy, eBay, Facebook and Twitter, little rectangular slips of paper started showing up for sale in late January. Printed on card stock, they measured 3 by 4 inches and featured crisp black lettering. Sellers listed them for $20 to $60 each, with a discount on bundles of three or more. Laminated ones cost extra.

articles.headline: After Pandemic, Shrinking Need for Office Space Could Crush Landlords
articles.snippet: Some big employers are giving up square footage as they juggle remote work. That could devastate building owners and cities.
articles.abstract: Some big employers are giving up square footage as they juggle remote work. That could devastate building owners and cities.
articles.lead_paragraph: As office vacancies climb to their highest levels in decades with businesses giving up office space and embracing remote work, the real estate industry in many American cities faces a potentially grave threat.
articles.byline: By Peter Eavis and Matthew Haag

articles.headline: Drought in Taiwan Pits Chip Makers Against Farmers
articles.snippet: The island is going to great lengths to keep water flowing to its all-important semiconductor industry, including shutting off irrigation to legions of rice growers.
articles.abstract: The island is going to great lengths to keep water flowing to its all-important semiconductor industry, including shutting off irrigation to legions of rice growers.
articles.lead_paragraph: HSINCHU, Taiwan — Chuang Cheng-deng’s modest rice farm is a stone’s throw from the nerve center of Taiwan’s computer chip industry, whose products power a huge share of the world’s iPhones and other gadgets.
articles.byline: By Raymond Zhong and Amy Chang Chien
